'Strontium-90' ('{{SimpleNuclide2|strontium|90}}') is a radioactive isotope of
strontium produced by nuclear fission with a half-life of 28.8 years. It
undergoes Î² â decay into yttrium-90, with a decay energy of
0.546 MeV. Strontium-90 has applications in
medicine and industry and is an isotope of concern in fallout from nuclear
weapons and nuclear accidents.
